text:
President Biden is finally admitting his mistake and resuming the construction of fencing along the border. 
Let’s be clear, just like he did in Afghanistan, President Biden was shamefully willing to sacrifice American lives and security in pursuit of a campaign talking point.

Since Joe Biden took office:
➡️ 6 million illegal crossings at the border
➡️ Fentanyl is killing the equivalent of a plane full of Americans every day
➡️151 people on the terrorist watchlist have been stopped trying to cross the border
You can see the gaps in the border fencing that the Biden administration unbelievably refused to complete – despite the fact fencing supplies sat readily available just a few hundred yards away.

When he was running for President, Joe Biden said “not another foot” of physical barriers along our border would be built under his watch. Biden kept his word. These photos are from my border tour just a few months after Biden was sworn into office.

I believe Rep. @SteveScalise is the right choice to be our new Speaker and guide @HouseGOP through a difficult time. 

Read my full statement ⬇️
We can do common sense reforms that do not impact retirees or near-retirees, coupled with policies to foster economic growth, to ensure these mandatory programs exist for future generations.

Our appropriations bills only fund the green + yellow portions on this chart. The rest is mandatory spending and it’s not stopped by a shutdown. I’m as concerned as anyone about our $33 trillion in debt, but let’s be honest about what will and won’t address our debt crisis.
Here is my statement on the decision by eight House Republicans to partner with the Democratic Caucus to remove Kevin McCarthy as the Speaker of the House ⬇️

No one worked harder to secure our Republican House majority than @SpeakerMcCarthy.

No one has done more to advance Republican policy goals than @SpeakerMcCarthy.

Removing him as Speaker would be handing Democrats a gift.

Patients diagnosed with aggressive cancer need support immediately. That's why I cosponsored H.R. 549 to waive the 5-month waiting period for Social Security Disability Insurance  and the 24-month waiting period for Medicare benefits for individuals with metastatic breast cancer.

.@SpeakerMcCarthy has led the @HouseGOP to advance our goals of stopping President Biden’s inflationary spending, addressing the border crisis, protecting parental rights, and keeping America safe. Let's stop fighting with each other and focus on fighting for solutions.

I just voted along with a bipartisan majority of the House of Representatives to prevent a federal government shutdown and approve additional federal disaster funding.

Read my full statement below ⬇️

Don’t believe the Democrats disinformation campaign. There is NO pay raise for House Members in the bill. Any potential member COLA does not take effect until January, this CR is only for 45 days, so there is NO COLA for Members.

The House is voting today on a stopgap funding bill that will prevent a gov’t shutdown and:

✅ Pay our troops
✅ Fund federal disaster aid
✅ Keep transportation projects moving
✅ Fund services for veterans + seniors

I hope my Inland Empire colleagues join me in voting YES.

With hours remaining before a government shutdown, House Democrats just offered a motion to adjourn until Monday. 

We need to get to work to keep our government open and our troops and border patrol paid, while Congress gets its job done passing individual appropriations bills.

I don’t think a government shutdown solves anything. If we do find ourselves in an unfortunate shutdown, I have asked for my pay to be suspended, and my office will remain open to serve constituents. I will remain in D.C. working to find solutions to this impasse.

That is why I voted today for a CR to avoid a government shutdown, secure our border and cut overall funding to address our mounting fiscal challenges. Unfortunately, all House Democrats and a small number of House Republicans opposed the bill, and it was defeated.

With the federal fiscal year ending on Saturday at midnight, it’s clear we need a short-term funding bill (continuing resolution or CR) to keep the government open until we complete our work passing individual appropriations bills.
My statement on the passing of Senator Dianne Feinstein:

🚨 The House of Representatives just passed the FY24 Defense Appropriations bill. 🚨

Read my full statement ⬇️
I don’t think a government shutdown solves anything. If we find ourselves in a shutdown I have asked for my pay to be suspended, and my office will remain open to serve constituents.

I’m working to advance full-year individual appropriations bills with House GOP policy priorities. With the fiscal year ending on Saturday, we will need a short-term funding bill (Continuing Resolution) to keep the government open until we complete that work.
Including our valued ally Israel to the U.S. Visa Waiver Program is a positive step that is long overdue. 🇺🇸 🇮🇱
One of my top priorities as Chairman of the Defense Appropriations Subcommittee is modernizing our military and getting technologically superior tools in the hands of our warfighters.

The FY24 Defense Appropriations bill gives our junior enlisted servicemembers a historic pay increase. It's outrageous that President Biden cited that investment in our troops as a reason he'd veto this bill.

Nothing is coming into our country and killing more Americans than fentanyl. That's why our FY24 Defense Appropriations bill makes historic investments in combatting those who are bringing this deadly drug into our nation.
The FY24 Defense Appropriations bill is focused on securing our nation, taking care of our servicemembers, prioritizing innovation, and creating more efficiencies at the Department of Defense.
The first defense funding bill I am advancing to the House floor today as Chairman of the Defense Appropriations Subcommittee prioritizes our military superiority through technological innovation.
Our FY24 Defense Appropriations bill prioritizes the national security threat posed by the CCP.
Congratulations to Idyllwild’s famous furry friend Mayor Max for being featured on the @TODAYshow!

The SBA has announced the opening of its Coachella Valley Disaster Loan Outreach Center to aid those affected by Tropical Storm Hilary. Businesses of all sizes, farmers, nonprofit organizations, homeowners and renters may be eligible for low interest disaster loans.

The #BidenBorderCrisis is impacting communities across the country. The surges in illegal immigrant crossings are used by drug cartels to overwhelm border patrol resources making it easier to smuggle fentanyl across the border and into our neighborhoods.

The @SBAgov has announced the availability of disaster assistance loans to California businesses and residents affected by Tropical Storm Hilary. 

Details here: sba.gov/article/2023/09/22/s…

President Biden's border crisis is a humanitarian disaster, but it's also a national security threat. With border agents overwhelmed, all Americans should be concerned about those who are not being stopped at the border.
Wishing an easy and meaningful fast to all who observe. G'mar chatimah tovah.
We will never forget the ultimate sacrifice made by Gold Star Mothers on behalf of our nation. 🇺🇸

Earlier this week, I urged President Biden to approve the major disaster declaration requested by the Agua Caliente Band of Cahuilla Indians. The tribe and communities throughout the Coachella Valley are in need of federal resources as they recover from Tropical Storm Hilary.
I'm still committed to finding solutions that keep our government operating and avoiding a shutdown.

Thanks to a new law passed by Democrats last Congress, President Biden's new army of IRS agents will soon be coming with their hands out for more tax dollars if you sold Taylor Swift or other concert/sporting event tickets.

Today's @PressEnterprise editorial: Bidenomics isn’t achieving its promises
pressenterprise.com/2023/09/…

We don’t need a bigger bureaucracy to keep America safe. The FY24 Defense Appropriations bill reduces inefficiency at the Pentagon and reinvests those savings in programs that enhance lethality and ensure US military dominance.

Last week I stood in front of the Capitol and urged my colleagues to pass a defense appropriations bill. We need to get to work because a government shutdown would have serious negative impacts on our national security. There’s still time to do our job. Let’s get it done.
Biden’s border crisis is out of control. It’s time for the Biden administration to stop lying about the conditions at the border and work with Republicans to establish control of our border.

Few things are killing more Americans than fentanyl coming from China and ending up on our streets and now even our daycares. Today, the House could have taken up my bill to take historic steps to stop the flow of fentanyl. Disappointed a handful of my colleagues chose otherwise.

Today, I joined @RepZoeLofgren @SenAlexPadilla @SenFeinstein in leading the entire CA delegation in signing a letter calling on the Biden Administration to grant California’s request for a major disaster declaration in response to the ongoing impacts of Tropical Storm Hilary.
I said it last week and I’ll say it again, the U.S. military should never be held hostage to procedural votes in Congress. Our men and women in uniform deserve better.
Proud to support this bill to reauthorize the Debbie Smith DNA Backlog Grant Program, which funds the processing of rape kits. Every sexual assault victim deserves justice.
Let’s get to work!

When you back policies that reduce refining capacity and domestic production, you reduce supply. 

When you reduce supplies, you increase costs. 

The policies of radical Democrats are costing you more every time you fill up your gas tank.
Wishing the US Air Force a Happy 76th Birthday!
Please remember that you are not alone. If you need someone to talk to about how you’re feeling, call, text, or chat 988.

My highest priority in Congress is the defense of our nation. As I explained during a press conference on Friday, a government shutdown would be terrible for our national security. Let's fund our troops.

LA Sheriffs Deputy Ryan Clinkunbroomer was senselessly murdered last night while trying to serve and protect his community. My thoughts are with his family and colleagues in the law enforcement community.
The death of Mahsa Amini one year ago was a call to action. Today, we stand with the brave men and women demanding change in Iran. #MahsaAmini
You are not forgotten.

I’m pleased to share that the Western Riverside County Regional Conservation Authority was selected to receive a $8,971,625 grant from @USFWS to acquire habitat land in support of the Western Riverside County Multiple Species Habitat Conservation Plan. calvert.house.gov/media/pres…

More and more Riverside County residents are finding themselves out of work. The unemployment rate in the Inland Empire has jumped up to 5.3%. Just last month it was 4.9% and it was 3.8% one year ago.

Higher prices, fewer jobs. #Bidenomics is not helping working families.

Recent reports found the Biden Administration is wasting $53,000 per household in some cases to connect homes to the internet. This week I urged CA officials to protect taxpayers by utilizing satellite-based solutions in situations where traditional broadband is cost prohibitive.
California’s EV mandate will force families to buy cars that on average cost more, are powered by batteries predominantly made in China, and are dependent on an unreliable energy infrastructure.

One of the reasons California has the highest poverty rate in the nation is because the state continues to pass mandates that raise the cost of the goods and services our working class depends upon every day.

I just voted for the Preserving Choice in Vehicle Purchases Act, a bill I cosponsored which would block California’s misguided effort to take away your ability to choose the type of car you can purchase.

Riverside County and the Coachella Valley continue to feel the impacts from Tropical Storm Hilary. I urge the Biden Admin to quickly approve CA’s disaster declaration request submitted today so that residents, communities and small businesses have access to additional resources.

Bidenomics has resulted in avg Americans being poorer than they were 4 years ago. Democrat spending, over-regulation and their war on American energy production is crushing family budgets. If voters want to stop lingering inflation + high gas prices, then we need a new President.
Read more about the bill: calvert.house.gov/media/pres…

Every dollar we invest in DERA is leveraged w/ investments by the private sector, nonprofit organizations, & local governments. @EPA estimates the total lifetime value of all DERA investments since the program’s inception has resulted in $8 billion in health-related benefits.

I have advocated for the Diesel Emissions Reduction Act (DERA) program because of the tangible health benefits it provides to our communities. That's why I've joined @DorisMatsui, @RepGregPence and @ChelliePingree to introduce bipartisan legislation reauthorizing DERA.
Giving the Iranian regime - the largest sponsor of terrorism in the world - access to $6 billion will have deadly consequences.
Proud to work again on a bipartisan effort to reduce the use of animals in testing.

Earlier today, I testified before the House Rules Committee about the Fiscal Year 2024 Defense Appropriations Bill that I have drafted along with my @HouseAppropsGOP colleagues to provide for the security of our nation.

I just voted to pass the MAHSA Act (H.R.589), a bill I cosponsored to impose sanctions on the Iranian regime for their human rights abuses and support for terrorism. 

The strong bipartisan vote for this bill stands in stark contrast to Pres. Biden’s weakness and capitulation.
Our FY24 Defense Appropriations bill prioritizes the national security threat posed by the CCP.

The men and women who serve in our military are our greatest asset in achieving America’s national security goals. That’s why our FY24 Defense Appropriations bill makes a historic investment in our troops.
Today, we remember the lives that were ended far too soon and we give thanks for the bravery of those who ran towards danger to help their fellow citizens. We will never forget.🇺🇸
I spoke with @KESQ about getting the resources necessary to get Indian Canyon Road open, and keep it open.

Long term, I’ll be working with local officials as well as our state and federal partners to make significant upgrades that protect the road from future flooding in addition to blow sand closures. By working together, I know we can get this done for the Coachella Valley.

The closure of Indian Canyon Road impacts critical access to Desert Regional Medical Center, Palm Springs Airport, and 29 Palms Marine Corps base. Once a federal disaster declaration is requested and approved, we need funding to reopen the road as soon as possible.

I joined officials from Palm Springs, Desert Hot Springs, Cathedral City, and CVAG earlier today to inspect damage from Tropical Storm Hilary at Indian Canyon Road and discuss how to fund improvements that will keep vital transportation corridors open.

I worked together with @NormaJTorres to secure permit approval from the @USACEHQ to ensure construction of the Limonite Gap Closure Project in @CityEastvaleCA was not delayed. Without the permit, the project would’ve been delayed until April '24 & cost an addition $2 MIL.

The Biden Administration’s new restrictions on domestic energy production means you will pay even more when filling up your gas tank and heating your home this winter. That money will now head overseas, fueling the economies of and creating jobs in foreign countries.

It was great to see our community turn out this weekend at the Norco Fair. Congratulations to all who participated in the Jr. Livestock Show and Auction. I was also thrilled to be on hand for the ribbon cutting of “The Barn,” a new multi-use facility at the Ingals Event Center.

The US is $32 trillion in debt and the Biden Administration is spending $53,000 per household in some cases to connect homes to the internet when satellite-based solutions can provide a similar connection for hundreds of dollars.
wsj.com/us-news/the-53-000-c…
Happy Labor Day! 🇺🇸
Stay off the roads in Coachella Valley if you can. Stay safe!
Important food assistance update for any Coachella Valley/Riverside County households with food loss due to power outages or other impacts from Tropical Storm Hilary.
I want to thank @RivCoDA for pursuing justice in this case and sending a strong message to anyone trafficking fentanyl here in Riverside County. We must meet this crisis with bold actions.

I’m proud of the progress we’re making to cut FDA’s primate tests. For years, I have been leading efforts to replace outdated FDA animal tests with more humane, efficient & effective modern alternatives.  Thank you @WhiteCoatWaste for your support. 
washingtonexaminer.com/news/…

“Lower-income workers have been the hardest hit by higher prices, particularly for food and other necessities…”

#Bidenomics
cnbc.com/2023/08/31/living-p…

We simply cannot accept the reality of having people living on our streets. It’s not in the best interest of the individual living on the street, nor our community’s.

More info: calvert.house.gov/media/pres…
I’m happy to announce that I have secured federal funding to support local efforts to reduce homelessness in the Fiscal Year 2024 Transportation, Housing and Urban Development Appropriations bill.
Our Majority Leader @SteveScalise is a survivor with an incredible determination and passion to serve his community and country. I'll be keeping him and his family in my prayers.
President Biden’s open border policies are a national security threat to all Americans. It’s time for the Senate to join House Republicans in passing border security legislation.

The average price of a gallon of gasoline in California is $2 higher today than it was when President Biden was sworn into office. The anti-energy policies of Democrats in Washington and Sacramento continue to cost consumers more every day. #Bidenomics

My bill dedicating the Norco Post Office in memory of Lance Cpl. Kareem Nikoui ensures our community will always recognize his ultimate sacrifice. On today’s solemn anniversary my office arranged for this tribute to once again honor our local hero.

As I said then: ‘Years from now, a young boy or girl will come here & ask their parents about Kareem Nikoui. And even though many days may pass between this moment & that one, I have no doubt they too will be inspired and in awe by the story of Norco’s hero – Kareem Nikoui.’”

For the past two years, our community has stood beside the families of the fallen, and that support must not fade as time passes. Earlier this year, I stood with Lance Cpl. Nikoui’s parents as we dedicated the Lance Corporal Kareem Nikoui Memorial Post Office in Norco.

Two years ago today, we lost 13 American heroes. Dozens more were injured. Scores of Afghans were murdered. The Kabul bombing extracted a heavy toll here in the Inland Empire with the loss of three patriots: Lance Cpl. Kareem Nikoui, Cpl. Hunter Lopez, & Lance Cpl. Dylan Merola.
We will never forget.

My office and I will be working collaboratively with the city of Palm Springs, @CVAGnews and our county and state partners to address this damage and to find solutions that ensure residents can access Desert Regional Medical Center as well as the airport.
As the Coachella Valley continues to recover from the impacts of Tropical Storm Hilary, my office and I stand ready to assist 41st Congressional District residents.

The Riverside County Emergency Management Agency is seeking assistance from the public to document the damage from Tropical Storm Hilary. This information will be used to help determine the impact to the region and the need for additional resources.

survey123.arcgis.com/share/0…

There’s no place for violence against anyone in our society because of their beliefs, gender, race, sexual orientation, or for any reason. All people deserve to be safe in our communities and this horrific shooting is a tragic reminder that we must work together toward that end.

Tropical Storm Hilary caused significant damage throughout the 41st Congressional District, especially in Coachella Valley, and other parts of California. Our residents, businesses, and local communities need resources to help cleanup and recover from this disaster.

I led a letter, along with @SpeakerMcCarthy and Reps. Valadao, Steel, Obernolte, Garcia, Kiley, and Kim, asking President Biden to quickly approve a major federal disaster declaration from Tropical Storm Hilary should a request be made by the Governor.
Thank you @CalGuard for supporting our local emergency responders!
The I-10 remains closed in both directions between Haugen Lehman and Bob Hope.
Please stay off the roads if possible.
Rest assured, I will keep advocating for any resources our communities require in the hours, days and weeks to come.

FEMA has pre-positioned supplies at March Air Reserve Base, and a FEMA Incident Management Assistance Team has deployed to the California Office of Emergency Services and is prepared to assist with any requests for federal assistance.
My office has been in contact with federal and local officials in advance of Tropical Storm Hilary’s impact. All emergency management teams have been working tirelessly to prepare for this storm.
Here is the latest information from the @NWS about what to expect and when to expect it as Tropical Storm Hilary makes its way into Southern California.

This is a joke. Gov. Newsom must think Californians aren't paying attention. Serial car thieves don't do more than a few days in jail in CA. So even if these criminals are caught, they'll be back on the street in no time under the pro-criminal justice system created by Democrats.

#Bidenomics is NOT helping Riverside County families. We need to strangle inflation by ending runaway spending, unleash American-made energy, and end costly mandates that have driven up the cost to build new homes.  4/4

Today, with a 7.09% mortgage rate, if that family wanted to have that same monthly mortgage payment of $2,291 – after again putting 20% down – they would only be able to purchase a $385,000 home.  3/4
When mortgage rates were around 4%, before Joe Biden became President, a Riverside County family could purchase a $600,000 home, with 20% down, and have a monthly mortgage payment of $2,291.  2/4

My dad explained to me long ago that people don’t buy houses, they buy mortgage payments. 

The average mortgage rate just rose to 7.09%, its highest level in more than 20 years. What does that mean for mortgage payments?  1/4
We don't know what impact this storm will have in Riverside County and the Coachella Valley, but it never hurts to be prepared and have a plan.

The Riverside County Sheriff's Department just received funding I requested in the FY23 Appropriations bill to acquire breakthrough Rapid DNA technology that will enable them to more quickly process DNA samples and bring criminals to justice more expeditiously.
Thanks again to our local first responders and everyone from our community who has stepped up to help those in need.

As California families are heading back to school, they are experiencing the high cost of #Bidenomics. 
latimes.com/california/newsl…

American tax dollars are also flowing overseas, where Chinese manufacturers could take up to $125 BIL in renewable energy credits. Biden + Congressional Democrats misled the American people from the outset of the "Inflation Reduction Act" and taxpayers continue to pay the price.

That wasn’t the only missed projection - the $7,500 EV tax credit will cost $101 billion vs. the original $14 billion estimate. According to a study, 73% of EV owners covered by the law’s $7,500 EV tax credit would have purchased an EV anyway.

What has the law done? According to the Joint Committee on Taxation, 90% of the so-called ”green” special interest tax breaks have gone to billion dollar corporations. The cost to taxpayers is now estimated to be over $650 billion, 240% higher than originally projected.

One year ago today, President Biden signed the "Inflation Reduction Act" into law. Since then, even Biden has admitted Republicans in Congress were correct in pointing out the law had nothing to do with reducing inflation.
"Sen. Alex Padilla and Rep. Ken Calvert (R–Corona) introduced the legislation to transfer the aircraft to CAL FIRE."

"CAL FIRE must be adequately prepared and equipped to meet the threat from wildfires that are increasing in size and intensity, and the transfer of these C-130s to CAL FIRE will significantly strengthen the effectiveness of their response.” 
sjvsun.com/wildfires/cal-fir…
We will never forget.

Two years ago today, the American Embassy in Afghanistan was evacuated as President Biden’s disastrous withdrawal led to the Taliban’s capture of Kabul. The scars from these avoidable mistakes remain in the the loss of lives, injuries, and lack of trust in the U.S. as a partner.

I know I speak for our entire region in expressing my deep appreciation for these local heroes who have once again stepped forward to help those need. Our prayers remain with the residents of Maui and everyone impacted by this horrible tragedy.
Reminder - The deadline to submit an intent to file for backdated PACT Act benefits is tonight at midnight ET.

California needs all of the support we can get in combatting wildfires and these aircraft will provide desperately needed assistance in protecting lives and property. I have been working with @SenAlexPadilla to get these aircraft to CA & ready to fight fires as soon as possible.

The decision by Biden’s DOJ to grant special counsel status to the same prosecutor who crafted an unprecedented sweetheart plea deal for the President’s son seems designed only to drag out this investigation until after next year’s election and hamper the oversight of @HouseGOP.
Gold Star families of the 13 American heroes killed during President Biden’s disastrous Afghanistan withdrawal deserve answers and accountability.

An important PACT Act deadline is coming up this week, so I am encouraging veterans in the 41st Congressional District and elsewhere to file your PACT Act claim, or intent to file, by August 9th to be eligible for backdated benefits. Learn more at va.gov/PACT

Our firefighters selflessly put themselves in danger to keep us safe. I’m heartbroken by the loss of our @CALFIRERRU heroes who were killed in a tragic helicopter crash while fighting a wildfire here in Riverside County. My prayers are with their colleagues and families.
Between inflation, energy costs, public safety, and our broken border - a majority of Americans understand that only House Republicans are taking meaningful steps that address these problems.

I agree, that’s why Sec. 8150 of my FY24 Defense Appropriations bill would pull security clearances for the Democrat + Republican intel officials who lied to Americans about the Hunter Biden laptop. The facts uncovered by @HouseGOP about the Bidens should concern everyone.
I spoke with The Inland Gateway of Realtors this morning about the continued impacts of inflation on the housing market and steps we can take to improve affordability.

I'm working with cities across the 41st District to help them meet their transportation challenges. 
ukenreport.com/local-and-reg…

An important PACT Act deadline is just a week away, so I am encouraging veterans in the 41st Congressional District and elsewhere to file your PACT Act claim, or intent to file, by August 9th to be eligible for backdated benefits. Learn more at va.gov/PACT

#Bidenomics in action. Biden and Democrats in Congress recklessly spent $3 TRILLION outside of our normal budget process during his first two years in office. 

@HouseGOP are the only ones responsible for stopping this runaway inflationary spending.

Americans deserve a blind application of justice. The House of Representatives must continue to provide oversight of the DOJ to ensure all Americans are treated equally under the law, regardless of their political party or family connections.

Under Biden’s Justice Department, the President’s political enemies are being indicted with unprecedented charges, while his family members are receiving unprecedented sweetheart plea deals and special treatment.

Connecting the Coachella Valley with the rest of southern California by passenger rail will provide tremendous economic and congestion relief benefits. I'm proud to be working with local leaders to secure federal funding to make this big project happen. 

patch.com/california/palmdes…

My staff & I have worked collaboratively with the cities and transportation agencies in our district to prioritize the critical projects that are needed. We have more work to do to relieve congestion, which is why I will continue to focus on real solutions that get people moving.

I'm happy to announce that I have secured significant federal funding in our annual transportation appropriations bill that will help build projects all around the 41st District to relieve congestion and benefit commuters. 
calvert.house.gov/media/pres…

Our Constitution is clear: 

▶ The executive branch must not administer a two-tiered system of justice. 

▶ The executive branch must not limit our free speech rights.

I will continue to fight to protect these fundamental rights. 

wsj.com/articles/facebook-bo…
On #NationalInternDay I want to thank our DC office summer interns - Anthony, Christian, Shannon, and Alex - for all of their help serving the constituents in the 41st Congressional District.

As our economy becomes increasingly reliant on the support of space-based systems and services, we must act accordingly to increase the safeguards that shield them from any potential threats. This bipartisan effort will help protect space infrastructure.

The bill provides for a full year funding level of $138 billion for veterans’ medical care, matching the Presidents' FY24 Budget Request, and fully funds veterans’ health care and toxic exposure-related needs for FY24

The House just approved more than $225 million for upgrades at March Air Reserve Base. After fighting to have the next generation of air tankers based at March, I’m leading the way to ensure our Riv. Co. installation has the necessary upgrades to support these vital aircraft.

I have made it clear that as we work to address our fiscal crisis, we will not waiver in our commitments to our veterans. I just voted for a bill that fully funds our VA healthcare and toxic exposure programs. I will always protect our veterans and the benefits they have earned.

When Julie Su led the @CA_EDD it paid a firm $55 million to operate a call center that failed to answer over 73 million phone calls from unemployed workers seeking help with unemployment benefits. The last thing workers need is Julie Su in charge of the U.S. Dept. of Labor.

Today's historic interest rate increase is a direct result of the inflationary spending and economic policies backed by President Biden and Democrats in Congress. Thanks to #Bidenomics, prices for consumers are up 15.7 percent since President Biden took office.

Last night, I voted for the Stop Chinese Fentanyl Act, bipartisan legislation to crack down on Chinese opioid manufacturers. More than one Riverside County resident is dying on average every day from fentanyl. We must do more to stop these drugs from entering our communities.

I recently had the pleasure of being the guest of honor, along with my colleague Rep. Betty McCollum, at the U.S. Marine Corps “Evening Parade” at the @MBWDC. The Parade is a truly wonderful experience and tradition in Washington, D.C.
We should be working to find ways to lower health care costs for California families. That is why I joined this effort along with @RepSteel urging Sacramento Democrats to provide tax relief.

It was an honor to hear from Israel’s President, Isaac Herzog. I stand with Israel in the defense of their nation against threats from Iran, Hezbollah & Hamas; their absolute right to exist; & their constant struggle to combat antisemitism.  God Bless America & God Bless Israel!
I believe we can find ways to get our warfighters advanced tools in a faster timeframe while also lowering costs for U.S. taxpayers.
Not only will this expand the defense industrial base, but it will create disruption within the Services to existing incumbent providers and help maintain our technological edge.

The NDAA includes my legislation, the DOD Entrepreneurial Innovation Act, which requires each military branch to designate at least 5 programs whose research & development was funded through a DOD Small Business Innovation Program (SBIR) as an Entrepreneurial Innovation Project.

The NDAA includes a provision I requested to improve the safety of U.S. troops by adding requirements to the Joint Safety Council. This language echoes the intent of the MEZr Act, legislation I intro'd earlier this year which was inspired by the tragic death of Lt. David Schmitz.

The NDAA includes a provision I requested to facilitate the transfer of 7 excess C-130 aircraft from the @uscoastguard to California for use in wildfire suppression. This is a bipartisan effort I've worked on with @SenAlexPadilla to better combat wildfires here in our state.

I voted for the 2024 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) today, which includes pay-raises for men and women in uniform and focuses our military on the national security threats we face around the globe.

Today, I joined my @HouseAppropsGOP colleagues in approving the FY24 State + Foreign Operations Appropriations bill, which prioritizes efforts to strengthen our national security, counter the Chinese Communist Party, as well as provide support to American allies - like Israel.

Producing energy in America lowers costs for people at the gas pump and at home. It also creates jobs and grows our economy. I will continue to support policies that help secure America's energy independence.
It was also a pleasure to spend some time with General Eric Smith, the Assistant Commandant of the Marine Corps.

Today, I had the honor of attending the relinquishment of office ceremony for outgoing Commandant of the Marine Corps Gen. David Berger. For the past 42 years, General Berger has proudly served his nation and lead the Marine Corps with a focus on modernization.

"Had the court not ruled as it did, this president and all future presidents would have been able to sign executive orders that directed money from the U.S. Treasury to any interest group or voting bloc, any time, regardless of the cost and with no limits of any kind."

A federal judge ruled this week that the Biden Administration illegally colluded with social media platforms to silence Americans. The ruling is a victory for free speech, First Amendment rights, and a warning sign for Big Tech.

The Biden Administration shamefully released this report on a Friday afternoon of a holiday weekend. The families of the fallen heroes at Abbey Gate and those we left behind deserve real accountability and transparency from Pres. Biden, not more deflecting of responsibility.

Last week, I joined @RepMikeGarcia and @SecAFOfficial at the North LA Defense Forum. The event was organized by Rep. Garcia and provided a venue for defense stakeholders to discuss how we rise to meet our growing national security threats, especially China.

Happy Independence Day!

I hope you and your family have a wonderful day celebrating our incredible country. 🇺🇸

Be sure to check the expiration dates on your passports and plan ahead. If you have any questions or need assistance don’t hesitate to contact my office. We’ve helped hundreds of 41st District constituents so far this year in dealing with these passport backlogs.
Iranian-backed terrorists are a direct threat to the safety of Israeli civilians. The U.S. must continue to support Israel in their efforts to protect its people and secure peace in the region.

Last night, I attended the Lake Elsinore Valley Chamber of Commerce’s Salute To The Elected dinner. We are incredibly fortunate to have a strong, collaborative relationship between our local leaders and the small business community here in Riverside County.
The Prado Dam Bicentennial Mural is going to look incredible when it is lit up at night on July 4th!

The bill will improve the safety of U.S. service members by establishing and implementing a new transparent system for analyzing and addressing nonconformity issues found in all major accidents and mishaps throughout the military.

The legislation is inspired by the death of my constituent and F-16 pilot First Lt. David Schmitz (callsign “MEZr”) whose ejection seat malfunctioned while attempting a nighttime landing that ultimately resulted in a fatal crash.

I have introduced the Military Equipment Quality and Safety Reform Act or MEZr Act (H.R. 4214) to better protect the lives of our most precious national security resource – the men and women who serve in our military.

Prioritizing defense spending essential to our national security has been a priority for @HouseGOP from the outset of this debt ceiling negotiation. The Fiscal Responsibility Act reflects that by rejecting Democratic demands for parity between defense and non-defense funding.

Read my full statement on The Fiscal Responsibility Act:
 
calvert.house.gov/media/pres…

The bill also includes a number of Republican policy goals. The Fiscal Responsibility Act reflects and addresses the reality that we don’t have a revenue problem in Washington, we have a spending problem.
Republicans and @SpeakerMcCarthy were able to negotiate these savings while protecting our veterans, defense spending, as well as Social Security and Medicare.

The level of taxpayer savings in this bill is historic. 

The bill reduces non-defense discretionary spending by $40 billion – the largest amount ever. 

The bill claws back nearly $28 billion in unspent COVID funding – the largest rescission of federal funds in history.

I promised voters I would stop the runaway spending in DC. Unlike Pres. Biden and Democrats in Congress who recklessly spent trillions of taxpayer money, The Fiscal Responsibility Act will do just that – return fiscal responsibility and sanity to the federal spending process.
